summary: This is a letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP, representing Deutsche Bank, to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It transmits the eighth production of documents in response to a July 11, 2019 grand jury subpoena, specifically check images from approximately twenty bank accounts controlled by Jeffrey Epstein and/or his close associates. The letter asserts confidentiality and privilege protections.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: The recipient of the letter from Deutsche Bank's legal counsel regarding the production of documents in response to a grand jury subpoena concerning Jeffrey Epstein's financial records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the grand jury investigation; the document production includes check images from bank accounts he controlled.

persons.name: Parvin D. Moyne
persons.context: One of the signing attorneys from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP representing Deutsche Bank in its response to the subpoena.

persons.name: James J. Benjamin, Jr.
persons.context: One of the signing attorneys from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP representing Deutsche Bank in its response to the subpoena.

persons.name: Thomas C. Moyer
persons.context: One of the signing attorneys from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP representing Deutsche Bank in its response to the subpoena.

connections.description: Moyne, along with Benjamin and Moyer, are attorneys from Akin Gump representing Deutsche Bank in its legal response to a grand jury subpoena.
Benjamin is an attorney from Akin Gump representing Deutsche Bank in its legal response to a grand jury subpoena.
Moyer is an attorney from Akin Gump representing Deutsche Bank in its legal response to a grand jury subpoena.
Rossmiller, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the office investigating Epstein, as evidenced by the subpoena for his financial records.
Deutsche Bank held approximately twenty bank accounts controlled by Jeffrey Epstein and/or his close associates, which are the subject of the subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Deutsche Bank, compelling the production of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial accounts.

events.title: Eighth Document Production to SDNY
events.description: Deutsche Bank's counsel submitted the eighth production of documents in response to the subpoena, containing check images from approximately twenty accounts controlled by Epstein and/or his associates.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was responding to a July 11, 2019 grand jury subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The production included check images from approximately twenty bank accounts controlled by Jeffrey Epstein and/or his close associates.
The document asserts confidentiality under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e) and seeks to protect against disclosure via FOIA or to third parties.
The letter is the eighth in a series of rolling productions from Deutsche Bank to the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Deutsche Bank's legal counsel explicitly states that the production does not waive any applicable attorney-client privilege or other legal protections.
